meanings.definition: The act of selling goods or services door-to-door.
meanings.sent1: She engaged in pedlary by going from house to house selling her handmade crafts.
meanings.sent2: Pedlary was a common way for people to earn money before the rise of big retail stores.
meanings.sent3: The pedlary business was booming, with each knock on the door bringing a potential sale.
meanings.sent4: Her pedlary skills were so sharp that she could convince anyone to buy something they didn't even know they needed.
meanings.sent5: The image of the pedlar with a basket of goods on his arm epitomized the essence of pedlary.

meanings.definition: The occupation or business of a peddler.
meanings.sent1: His family had been in pedlary for generations, traveling far and wide to sell their goods.
meanings.sent2: Pedlary required a lot of stamina and people skills to be successful.
meanings.sent3: The peddler's pedlary took him to many interesting places, meeting all kinds of customers.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, pedlary was seen as a humble yet essential profession.
meanings.sent5: The peddler's cart was a symbol of his dedication to the art of pedlary.

meanings.definition: The goods or wares sold by a peddler.
meanings.sent1: The peddler displayed his pedlary on a small wooden table by the roadside.
meanings.sent2: Customers were always curious to see the variety of pedlary the peddler carried in his pack.
meanings.sent3: The peddler's pedlary included everything from trinkets to household essentials.
meanings.sent4: The peddler's pedlary shone brightly under the midday sun, attracting passersby.
meanings.sent5: Each piece of pedlary had a story behind it, making them more than just items for sale.
